alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 6:46AM MST until January 17 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following county, Maricopa. * WHEN...Until 945 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 642 AM MST, Gauge reports indicate increased flow on washes and small creeks and streams such as New River and Cave Creek. High flows may make low water crossings and recreational areas dangerous. Travel into these areas is discouraged. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scottsdale, New River, Cave Creek, Carefree, Desert Mountain, Camp Creek and Seven Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
